Description: Ostrakon (sherd of pottery used as a writing medium). Made from the wall of a pottery transport amphora. The text, in Coptic (the everyday language of Greek and Roman Egypt, written in Greek characters), concerns the delivery of 13 carts (over 5,000 litres) of wheat.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Charles Ede (Writing and Lettering in Antiquity (May 1999) no. 35)
Acquisition notes: Mr Todd, of Jersey, acquired during the 1960s Funded by Departmental Purchase grant.
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Clackson 18 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
